metadata.titel_preek: Father and Mother of the Ungodly

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God initiates a cosmic plan of salvation by sovereignly calling and justifying the ungodly (Abraham/Sarah) to create a new humanity.

tekstueel_bewijs: God who justifies, rectifies, redeems, and remakes

object.identificatie: The justification and recreation of the ungodly/humanity
tekstueel_bewijs: calling into existence the things that do not exist
reveal God’s own self and God’s own purposes
the power of the promise of God

ontvanger.identificatie: Abraham, Sarah, and all the families of the earth
tekstueel_bewijs: by you all the families of the earth shall bless themselves
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is positioned as the 'ungodly' Receiver of an unmerited gift.

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus Christ who is the pioneer and perfecter of our faith
in the power of the Holy Spirit
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject; Christ is the Mediator/Helper of the promise.
helper.rol_van_geest: External power enabling the hearing of the Word.

tekstueel_bewijs: Because of Sin, it is not possible... for any congregation to 'unconditionally accept'
the greatest temptation is that of boasting
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described as an ontological power that 'wires' rivalry into DNA and makes human inclusion impossible.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The church's attempt to be 'inclusive' and 'welcoming' as a response to God's grace.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Congregation/Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The preacher warns that the secondary program (ethics) often tries to replace the primary (soteriology), leading to moralism.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God calls into existence the things that do not exist.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Abraham passes her off as his sister.

voorbeelden: We must continually maintain a posture of repentance.
Not the promptings of Abraham’s religious aspirations.
It shows us where we are rooted.
The power of the promise of God.
We are not capable of it. Only our Lord Jesus Christ was capable.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on human 'non-power' (incapacity) vs. God's 'all-power' (sovereign grace).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the false S1 (human inclusion) to the reality of S2 (Sin/Incapacity), then to the true S1 (God's justification of the ungodly).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in 'Life from the dead'—a creative act of God that bypasses human merit.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; Sin is treated as a totalizing force that ruins even good intentions.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon explicitly deconstructs moralism and exemplarism, making God the sole actor in the drama of salvation.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: We are an open, friendly, inclusive, welcoming congregation.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Trusts him who justifies the ungodly.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The preacher explicitly rejects Abraham as a model of virtue.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Abraham is the 'original ungodly person' who receives a promise.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the burden of performance; awe at God's power.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: Perfectly integrated; the ethical response is strictly a 'witness' to the primary soteriological act.
spanning_punten: The tension between the church's 'inclusive' language and the reality of Sin.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: God who justifies, rectifies, redeems, and remakes.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit enables the 'power of the promise' to be heard.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Total depravity (incapacity to even be truly inclusive).

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in theocentric narrative. God is the Subject of all transformative verbs.

modale_halans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is a 'Pure Grace' structure.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon perfectly exemplifies the 'Grammar of Grace' by keeping God as the Subject and the human as the ungodly beneficiary.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the use of the 'Father Abraham' song; semiotics shows the song is used to reinforce the Receiver actant.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Romans 4; semiotics shows how the sermon's 'engine' mirrors Paul's logic of justification.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'inclusive church' is actually an Opponent to Grace when it becomes a 'work' to boast about.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Subject-switch' from Abraham's virtue to God's promise as its primary narrative move.
